name: Next.js website
description: Next js website

name: Lambda Function
description: Short-lived serverless functions able to quickly scale up to 1000s of parallel executions with pay-per-use pricing.

referenceableParams.logGroupArn: Arn of the log group aggregating logs from the function

referenceableParams.customDomains: Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the Web Service (only available if you use [custom domain names](#custom-domain-names))
referenceableParams.customDomainUrls: Comma-separated list of custom domain name URLs (only available if you use [custom domain names](#custom-domain-names))
referenceableParams.cdnDomain: Default domain of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnUrl: Default url of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomains:
Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomainUrls:
Comma-separated list of custom domain name URLs of the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).

name: Container Workload
description: Fully managed, auto-scalable and easy-to-use runtime for your Docker containers.

name: Batch Job
description:
Fully managed, on-demand runtime for your container jobs with pay-per-use pricing.
Supports GPU compute resources.

referenceableParams.jobDefinitionArn: Arn of the job definition resource
referenceableParams.stateMachineArn: Arn of the state machine controlling the execution flow of the batch job
referenceableParams.logGroupArn: Arn of the log group aggregating logs from the batch job

referenceableParams.address: service `host:port` pair accessible only to other resources of stack([web-services](/compute-resources/web-services/), [multi-container-workloads](/compute-resources/multi-container-workloads/))

name: Edge Lambda Function
description: Short-lived serverless functions able to quickly scale up to 1000s of parallel executions with pay-per-use pricing.

referenceableParams.name: AWS (physical) name of the bucket
referenceableParams.cdnDomain: Default domain of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnUrl: Default url of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomains:
Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomainUrls:
Comma-separated list of custom domain name URLs of the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).

name: SQL database (RDS & Aurora)
description: Fully managed relational databases (Postgres, MySQL, MariaDb, etc.) with support for clustering, failover & more.

referenceableParams.connectionString:
Fully-formed connection string that can be used to access the primary instance.
For aurora databases, this is connectionString to cluster endpoint, which can be used for both reads and writes.
Includes **host**, **port**, **username**, **password** and **dbName**.
referenceableParams.jdbcConnectionString:
Fully-formed connection string in JDBC form that can be used to access the primary instance.
Includes **host**, **port**, **username**, **password** and **dbName**.
referenceableParams.host:
Hostname (address) of the primary instance that can be used for both reads and writes.
For aurora databases, this is hostname of a cluster endpoint, which can be used for both reads and writes.
referenceableParams.dbName: Name of the automatically created database (can be configured using the `dbName` property).
referenceableParams.readerHost:
Hostname (address) used for reads only. (only available for `aurora-postgresql` and `aurora-mysql` engines).
If you have multiple instances, it is advised to use readerHost for reads to offload the primary (read/write) host.
ReaderHost automatically balances requests between available instances. Connections are auto-balanced among available reader hosts.
referenceableParams.readerConnectionString: Same as **connectionString** but targets readerHosts (only available for `aurora-postgresql` and `aurora-mysql` engines). Connections are auto-balanced among available reader hosts.
referenceableParams.readerJdbcConnectionString: Same as **readerConnectionString** but in JDBC format (only available for `aurora-postgresql` and `aurora-mysql` engines).
referenceableParams.readReplicaHosts:
Comma-separated list of read replica hostnames (only available if read replicas are configured).
Read replicas can only be used for read operations.
referenceableParams.readReplicaConnectionStrings:
Comma-separated list of connection strings (URLs) used to connect to read replicas
(only available when read replicas are configured). Read replicas can only be used for read operations.
referenceableParams.readReplicaJdbcConnectionStrings: Same as **readReplicaConnectionStrings** but in JDBC format (only available when read replicas are configured).

name: DynamoDb Table
description: Fully managed, serverless, highly-available and massively scalable key-value datastore.

referenceableParams.name: AWS (physical) name of the table
referenceableParams.streamArn: Arn of [DynamoDb stream](/resources/dynamo-db-tables/#item-change-streaming) (available only if `streamType` is configured)

name: MongoDb Atlas Cluster
description:
Fully managed MongoDb Atlas cluster.
Automatically deployed to your AWS account and managed within your stack.

referenceableParams.connectionString: Connection string (URL) that allows connecting to the cluster.

name: Redis Cluster
description: Fully managed, redis-compatible in-memory data store with sub-millisecond latency.

referenceableParams.host:
In case of NON-sharded cluster(default), this is a hostname of the primary instance that can be used for both reads and writes.
In case of sharded cluster, this is cluster's configuration endpoint that can be used for all operations.
referenceableParams.readerHost:
Hostname (address) that can be used for reads only. (only available for NON-sharded clusters).
If you use multiple replicas, it is advised to use readerHost for read operations to offload the primary host.
ReaderHost automatically balances requests between available read replicas.
referenceableParams.sharding: Indicates whether cluster is sharded. Available values: `enabled` or `disabled`.

name: Application Load Balancer
description:
Fully managed, Application (L7) Load balancer.
Routes HTTP requests to other resources.

referenceableParams.domain: default domain name of load balancer
referenceableParams.customDomains: Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the Load balancer (only available if you use [custom domain names](#custom-domain-names))
referenceableParams.cdnDomain: Default domain of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnUrl: Default url of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomains:
Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomainUrls:
Comma-separated list of custom domain name URLs of the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).

name: Network Load Balancer
description:
Fully managed, Network (L4) Load balancer.
Routes TCP/TLS traffic to other resources.

referenceableParams.domain: default domain name of load balancer
referenceableParams.customDomains: Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the Load balancer (only available if you use [custom domain names](#custom-domain-names))

name: Http Api Gateway
description: Fully managed, serverless HTTP Api Gateway with pay-per-request pricing.

referenceableParams.customDomains: Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the HTTP Api Gateway (only available if you use [custom domain names](#custom-domain-names))
referenceableParams.customDomainUrls: Comma-separated list of custom domain name URLs (only available if you use [custom domain names](#custom-domain-names))
referenceableParams.customDomainUrl: URL of the first custom domain name connected to this resource (only available if you use [custom domain names](#custom-domain-names))
referenceableParams.cdnDomain: Default domain of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnUrl: Default url of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomains:
Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomainUrls:
Comma-separated list of custom domain name URLs of the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).

name: Bucket
description: Durable and highly-available object storage with pay-per-use pricing.

referenceableParams.name: AWS (physical) name of the bucket
referenceableParams.cdnDomain: Default domain of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnUrl: Default url of the [CDN distribution](#cdn) (only available if you DO NOT configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomains:
Comma-separated list of custom domain names assigned to the [CDN](#cdn)
(only available if you configure custom domain names for the CDN).
referenceableParams.cdnCustomDomainUrls:
Comma-separated list of custom domain name URLs of the [CDN](#cdn)

name: User Auth Pool
description: Fully managed sign-ups, logins and authorization for your users with pay-per-use pricing.

name: Event Bus (EventBridge)
description:
Bus for your application events.
Other compute resources can subscribe to events published to the bus.

referenceableParams.archiveArn: Arn of the event bus archive (available only if the archivation is enabled)

name: State Machine (StepFunction)
description: State machines allow you to orchestrate your compute resources.

referenceableParams.name: AWS (physical) name of the state machine.

name: Custom Resource Instance
description:
Create custom logic.
Can be used to create resources inside your stack that are not natively supported by AWS Cloudformation, or to provision services from other providers.

name: Custom Resource Definition
description:
Allows you to define your custom resource provisioning logic.
Can be used to create resources inside your stack that are not natively supported by AWS Cloudformation, or to provision services from other providers.

name: Upstash Redis
description: Serverless redis database designed for the edge

referenceableParams.host: Hostname (address) of the Upstash Redis database.
referenceableParams.port: Port of the Upstash Redis database.
referenceableParams.password: Autogenerated password that can be used to authenticate towards the database.
referenceableParams.restToken: Rest token which can be used when reading/writing from/to the database using the REST API
referenceableParams.readOnlyRestToken: Rest token which can be used only for reading from the database using the REST API
referenceableParams.restUrl: Rest URL which can be used when communicating with the database using the REST API
referenceableParams.redisUrl: Standard redis url (including password) which can be used for connecting using cli.

name: Deployment Script
description:
Executes script as a part of the deployment process
The script is executed as a lambda function during deploy/delete operation

name: Web App Firewall
description: You can use firewall to protect your resources from common web exploits that could affect application availability, compromise security, or consume excessive resources.

name: OpenSearch (Elastic)
description: You can use firewall to protect your resources from common web exploits that could affect application availability, compromise security, or consume excessive resources.

referenceableParams.domainEndpoint: Endpoint used for communicating with your opensearch-domain
